summary: The text describes a story of someone descending to the underworld and witnessing the future birth of Roman leaders, whom the author, who wrote this account, already knew to be born. The narrative treats past events as if they were predictions of the future. It also discusses how the Romans defeated the Jews yet allowed them to retain their customs and religious practices, even after the destruction of the Temple and the cessation of the traditional priesthood, as foretold by prophets. It notes that Jews maintain their distinct traditions and circumcision, differentiating them from other nations.
